definition: to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
surname Yu
to meet/to encounter/to treat/to receive/opportunity/chance
danger/dangerous/rugged

sentences.english: An international radiotelephone signal word used by aircraft and ships in distress.
sentences.chinese: 遇險後，船員立刻發出求救信號。

sentences.english: At the neck of the wrecked deck, the reckoner checked the opaque cheque.
sentences.chinese: 在遇險的甲板的脖子，計算者檢查不透明的支票。

sentences.english: China's maritime rescue teams will continue to help search and rescue Vietnamese victims and survivors.
sentences.chinese: 中國海上搜救部門將繼續幫助搜救越南遇險漁民。

sentences.english: Seeing a ship on the horizon, we ran up a flag of distress.
sentences.chinese: 看到地平線上出現一隻船，我們連忙升起遇險信號旗。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to an emergency signal annunciator for calling help for vehicles, which relates to a vehicle attachment.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型涉及一種汽車附件即汽車遇險呼救信號器。

sentences.english: He was killed in air accident.
sentences.chinese: 他在那次飛機失事中遇險身亡。

sentences.english: Some deep-sea angler fish form unusual life partnerships.
sentences.chinese: 一些深海垂釣者形成了意外遇險協作夥伴。

sentences.english: Wear the PPE, the life insurance in distress.
sentences.chinese: 勞保用品穿戴好，遇險可把生命保。

sentences.english: The international morse code distress signal, S.O.S.
sentences.chinese: 國際通用的莫爾斯電碼遇險信號SOS。

sentences.english: Some children dream of rescuing others, or of threats to self or others.
sentences.chinese: 有的孩子還會夢見救其他人，自己或他人遇險等。

sentences.english: The insurance payments should be rated up for those people with risks.
sentences.chinese: 應向易遇險的人多徵收保險費。

sentences.english: Cui distress, and honor for a flight in time to honor to the impression he improved.
sentences.chinese: 翠遇險，榮及時相救，一乘機令玥改善對榮的印象。

sentences.english: Then the rescuers jump into the boat and are off to help those in danger.
sentences.chinese: 救生員們跳進船，出發去救助那些遇險者。

sentences.english: Conway flashed a distress signal with his pocket light.
sentences.chinese: 康維拿袖珍手電打出了遇險信號。

sentences.english: And when the economy falters, the P.M. traditionally gets the blame.
sentences.chinese: 而且當經濟遇險時，總理通常會被指責。

sentences.english: Stranded and in trouble, the crew sent out the S. O. S.
sentences.chinese: 船擱淺遇險後，船員立刻發出求救信號。

definition: the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to die in the line of duty
to make an amphibious assault/to seize a beachhead/to gain a foothold in (a new market)
to rescue/to be rescued
to hang oneself
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
perceptive/astute/sharp/sharp-witted/vigilant/alert
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
to escape (from prison)/to jump bail
prevail/convince
(idiom) to talk in a roundabout way to cover up the truth/evasive
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
